reviewText: Want to experience GTA 3 two years before GTA 3 was released? Well now you can!\n\nUrban Chaos is a fun semi-sandbox-ish action-adventure with guns, melee, vehicles (that are horrible) and a nightclub where you can dance. Sounds like something you've seen before? Sure you have, but this blew my mind back in 1999, and I still think it holds up.

reviewText:
The one that came before gta 3 , Urban Chaos is still probably the only sandbox 3d game that allows you to explore the city as a cop, which means you can ride cop cars without stealing it :D , arrest anyone.
The real charm of urban chaos is of course the story which is made up using one of the nostradamus predictions for year 2000. A lot of rumors were predicted for the year 2000 , this one cashed in good.

The game is a lot of fun to play even today.Some aspects annoy the heck out of you but mostly a fun game , here are the

Good
- gta style but play as the cops
-insane story
-tons of guns to use
-can improve stats rpg style
-vehicles+can run over peds
-mad controls specially for melee

Bad
-dated graphics
-hard missions specially timed ones and hostage =rage quit

a unique game thats worth the price , worth trying out

reviewText:
Remember GTA 3? I do. You wanna know something people don't often remember? Urban Chaos. And i don't see why. It's a sort of spiritual predescessor to it, in an odd way.

It looks alright for 1999 i suppose. Horrid by today's standards, but for the time, it looks decent. The draw distance is alright overall, my only major problem with it graphically is that it's always night. There's ONE mission that takes place during the day; otherwise, it's nighttime. It's my only complaint i can give for the game graphically that isn't caused by the time it was released.

Controls are a bit odd to get used to at first, but they work. Your character has Quasi-Tank Controls. While you CAN turn while moving, it's extremely finicky, and most of the time you're better stopping, turning and then moving. The fighting controls are okay, you've got your basic punching and kicking, and the special moves" (grapples and the like) are simply performed by hitting a particular direction while punching or kicking. It auto locks on to enemies for you
date: and shooting is as simple as hitting the punch button with a gun out locked on to an enemy. My only problem with the controls comes with vehicles; they control terribly. There's very little real grasp of physics with them
recommended: and while they don't nessescarily use the tank controls
hoursPlayed: sometimes when you stop the game will behave like you DO
voteText: and your car will be locked in place for no reason for a couple of seconds before being able to move again. Considering how fast your sprint is however
helpfulPercent: generally you shouldn't need a car.\n\nThe levels are fairly expansive
votesHelpful: and lend each mission a sort of Open-World vibe. There's secrets hidden around
commentsCount: weapon caches and all sorts of other stuff just begging for you to go off the beaten path to find. It can be a bit distracting from your main goal at times
column16: but overall i feel like it helps the game quite a lot
column17: it makes it go from what would've been a barebones linear Third Person Shooter with a decent melee combat system
column19: fun to explore Quasi-Sandbox game.\n\nDespite the minor flaws
column20: i really can't see why this game isn't remembered better. If it's on sale pick it up; these day's a bloody Potato could probably run it with no issue
column21: and it's fairly enjoyable.\n\nEDIT: Of note though
column22: apparently the game is extremely finicky on 64bit systems. Some it'll work on
column23: some it doesn't. If you have a 64bit system
column24: buy it at your own risk."

reviewText:
I'm not the greatest at reviewing games, so I'll do my usual gabber/rant.

THIS GAME, *was* my childhood. I spent countless hours playing and replaying this game, and it was the greatest!

I remember coming home from school many times and asking to play this game, I was legitimately excited to play this. So when I discovered earlier today that this game is on sale for £1.24, how could I refuse?!

In the many hours playing this game as a child I eventually found some pretty game breaking bugs like being immune to fire with a pistol equipped. Or when you back to a wall, tap forward, back to the wall again without moving forward or back, tap forward again and suddenly you're at the top of the building. Can legit finish the jumper mission in about less than 30 seconds using that glitch. And can't figure out how to get to that enemy on the top of the building? Have no fear! The backing-into-a-wall-to-get-to-the-top-of-the-building bug is here!

Bugs aside, the game still runs like a dream, for its time the combat is really smooth, movement handles well on both foot and vehicle (once you adjust to the unorthidox control scheme). The max resolution however is only 1024 x 768~, which is fine for a 16 year old game, it meant that when I tried to stream it I just had to capture the game via monitor recording, rather than window/game capture, but it was no biggy. The voice acting is superb for its time too, there are a lot of old games with awful voice acting *cough* Resident Evil *cough* that make you cringe at every scene with dialogue, but not with this game.

So to conclude:

Urban Chaos, a hidden gem that time forgot, sadly ahead of its time, I have still yet to meet a person who has actually heard, let alone played this game (it was released a full 2 years before the likes of GTA 3). Dated graphics and sound but great voice acting.

So that aside I give this game a solid 8/10, would definitely recommend - especially with it being £1.24 for the next couple days.

reviewText: Loved this game and played it to death back in the day, but I think it's just too old for modern computers to run properly. After around ten minutes the game becomes extremely laggy for no apparent reason, and even the main menu seems unresponsive at times. It also doesn't handle the 360 controller very well, but I hardly expected it to. My generic joypad works fine with the game, however.\n\nI honestly can't recommend this version, but if you're lucky enough to run it without any issues or you can find an old PS1 copy of the game, give it a chance. It's an immensely underappreciated game. Open world (to a limited degree) driving, fighting, shooting, platforming and the like -- how can you go wrong? And this was long before the overused GTA clone" label was applied to almost every similar style of game beyond the release Grand Theft Auto III."

reviewText:
I used to love this game for the Dreamcast, about fifteen years ago, but I have two problems. The first of which is a game breaker which is why I can't presently recommend the game. I'm not the only one to have experienced this. It doesn't take long to crash each time I play it. I found a widescreen mod online which works really well and displays the game at my native resolution. However, due to the game's instability I'm a bit annoyed that it's listed as compatible with Windows 7.

Secondly, this isn't really a big problem. In fact, I'm lucky it works at all for such an old game, which is controller support. The Xbox 360 controller only has a limited amount of its buttons compatible with old games. Most of the buttons work fine when I map them, but unless I run, I stay still or I start doing a moonwalk. I can control it with the keyboard, but a controller is so much better so I'd like to fix this. I can't even complete the first physical training course because it's too difficult to run straight and keep my balance.

So, the first one is what  absolutely needs fixing. The second would be nice. If somebody has a solution and I can play it properly, I will alter my review because it is a good game. It's a shame that my reunion is delayed.

reviewText:
Speaking as someone who had never played this game before, I really can't find anything to recommend about it. Maybe it played better on consoles back when it first came out, but unless you have some deep nostalgia for it, I suggest you give it a pass. Any enjoyment I might have derived from this game was lost in the numerous design and control issues.

I've never been a fan of tank controls, but in conjunction with an unruly camera with no mouse support and combat that demands immediate reaction it becomes extremely frustrating. The melee system allows you to perform combos, but you never will, because it's faster to just grapple the enemy and cuff him while he's on the ground. Guns have to be locked onto an enemy to hit, and trying to get locked onto the right enemy in the heat of battle while having to keep constantly on the move to evade enemies' bullets is no easy task. There are just too many annoyances in the combat to delve into all of them; getting caught in 'melee mode' so it becomes impossible to flee, enemies constantly sliding to knock you down the instant they get close, the list goes on.

On top of the combat issues, some of the game's mechanics only serve to compound the problem. There's no map, so it becomes an ordeal to navigate to several of your objectives, especially when the only way there is via a convoluted route across the rooftops that starts nowhere near the objective itself. There are no checkpoints and no way to save mid-mission, but many missions are way too long for such a handicap, especially considering that you'll also have to redo any side events or collectibles you got if you die. The story is pretty bare bones and towards the end takes on a supernatural element that goes completely unexplained.

Unless you've got a history with this game it's really not worth your time or money, even if it's dirt cheap.

reviewText:
Buyer beware. I used to LOVE this game back in the day. I beat the whole thing on my old-as-**** PC. So you might be tempted to buy it if you're feeling nostalgic like me.

Well, if you use an X-Box 360 wireless gamepad like I do... DON'T.

It won't work. The controls are totally glitched. Darci just spins around a lot and cannot be controlled. Even if you try keyboard-mapping through 3rd party software, it still won't work.

I wasted my money. Don't let this awful port waste yours too!!!
